SIMSSNR 1.0.0 documentation

GUI package

«  globvar module   ::   Contents   ::   GUIInitializationWidgets module  »

GUI package¶

GUI package for SIM application.

This package contains modules for the graphical user interface.

GUI.Box module¶

Box submodule for GUI.

Contains widgets and windows for the SIM box interface.

GUI.Box.Widgets module¶

Widgets.py

This module contains GUI widget classes for configuring and displaying different types of sources in the application.

The widgets allow users to interactively set parameters for sources such as intensity harmonics, plane waves, and point sources, and display their configurations.

Classes:

SourceWidget: Abstract base class for source widgets. IntensityHarmonic3DWidget: Widget for IntensityHarmonic3D sources. PlaneWaveWidget: Widget for PlaneWave sources. PointSourceWidget: Widget for PointSource sources.

class GUI.Box.Widgets.IntensityHarmonic3DWidget(ipw=None)[source]¶

Bases: SourceWidget

Widget for configuring and displaying IntensityHarmonic3D sources.

This widget provides an interface to input parameters for an intensity harmonic 3D source, including amplitude, phase, and wavevector components. It can display a pre-configured source or allow user input for a new one.

isSet¶

Signal emitted when the source is configured.

Type:

pyqtSignal

intensity_plane_wave¶

The configured source object.

Type:

IntensityHarmonic3D

data_widget¶

The input widget for parameters.

Type:

IntensityHarmonic3DInitializationWidget

change_widget()[source]¶

Change the widget’s configuration.

contextMenuEvent(event)[source]¶

Handle right-click context menu events.

Parameters:

event (QContextMenuEvent) – The context menu event.

init_ui(ipw)[source]¶

Initialize the user interface for the widget.

Parameters:

source – The source object.

isSet¶

int = …, arguments: Sequence = …) -> PYQT_SIGNAL

types is normally a sequence of individual types. Each type is either a type object or a string that is the name of a C++ type. Alternatively each type could itself be a sequence of types each describing a different overloaded signal. name is the optional C++ name of the signal. If it is not specified then the name of the class attribute that is bound to the signal is used. revision is the optional revision of the signal that is exported to QML. If it is not specified then 0 is used. arguments is the optional sequence of the names of the signal’s arguments.

Type:

pyqtSignal(*types, name

Type:

str = …, revision

on_receive_info(info)[source]¶

Process the input information from the initialization widget.

Parses the input, creates the source object, updates the display, and emits the configuration signal.

Parameters:

info (list) – List of input values [amplitude, phase, kx, ky, kz].

class GUI.Box.Widgets.PlaneWaveWidget(pw=None)[source]¶

Bases: SourceWidget

Widget for configuring and displaying PlaneWave sources.

This widget allows users to set parameters for a plane wave source, including field vectors, phases, and wavevector. It displays the configured source or provides input fields for a new one.

isSet¶

Signal emitted when the source is configured.

Type:

pyqtSignal

isDeleted¶

Signal emitted when the widget is deleted.

Type:

pyqtSignal

Type:

on_receive_info(info)[source]¶

Process the input information from the initialization widget.

Parses the input, creates the source object with real phases, updates the display, and emits the configuration signal.

Parameters:

info (list) – List of input values [Ep, Es, phasep, phases, kx, ky, kz].

class GUI.Box.Widgets.PointSourceWidget[source]¶

Bases: SourceWidget

Widget for configuring and displaying PointSource sources.

This widget allows users to set parameters for a point source, including coordinates and brightness. It displays the configured source or provides input fields for a new one.

Signal emitted when the source is configured.

Type:

pyqtSignal

coordinates¶

Type:

class GUI.Box.Widgets.SourceWidget(source=None)[source]¶

Bases: QWidget

Abstract base class for source configuration widgets.

This class provides a common interface for widgets that allow users to configure different types of sources in the SIM simulation.

Unique identifier for the widget instance.

Type:

int

GUI.Box.MainWindow module¶

GUI.Box.InitializationWidgets module¶

InitializationWidgets.py

This module contains widget classes for initializing parameters of different source types in the GUI.

These widgets provide input fields for users to enter parameters such as amplitudes, phases, and wavevectors for sources like intensity harmonics and plane waves.

Classes:

InitializationWidget: Abstract base class for initialization widgets. IntensityHarmonic3DInitializationWidget: Widget for IntensityHarmonic3D parameters. PlaneWaveInitializationWidget: Widget for PlaneWave parameters. PointSourceInitializationWidget: Widget for PointSource parameters.

class GUI.Box.InitializationWidgets.InitializationWidget[source]¶

Bases: QWidget

Abstract base class for source initialization widgets.

Provides a common structure for widgets that collect user input for source parameters.

abstractmethod on_click_ok()[source]¶

Handle the OK button click to process and emit the input data.

abstractmethod request_data()[source]¶

Set up the input fields for the widget.
